Julie: Well , Ross and I were in grad school together .

Rachel Green: Julie ! Julie , is n't that great ? I mean , is n't that just kick - you - in - the - crotch , spit - on - your - neck fantastic ?

#NOTE#: [ cut to later ]
original_item_data.inference: Rachel uses dramatic language to convey her feelings about Julie's presence.
original_item_data.human_annotated_explanation: Her phrase "kick-you-in-the-crotch, spit-on-your-neck fantastic" is extremely dramatic.

inference: Rachel uses dramatic language to convey her feelings about Julie's presence.
supporting_explanation: Rachel uses hyperbolic language to express her enthusiasm about Julie's presence, as evident in her statement "kick-you-in-the-crotch, spit-on-your-neck fantastic", which is a clear example of dramatic language.
opposing_explanation: Rachel's tone and language are actually neutral and friendly, with no indication of strong negative emotions or dramatic language.

I 'm so sick of being pregnant ! The only happiness I get is from a cup of coffee , which of course is decaf , ' cause - Oh ! I 'm pregnant !

inference: Phoebe has not experienced mood swings yet.

opposing_explanation: Phoebe's statement that she has not really had any mood swings yet is directly contradicted by her earlier mention of being "sick of being pregnant", which indicates irritability and frustration, characteristic symptoms of mood swings often associated with pregnancy.

original_item_data.dialogue:

Oh , uh , okay , that 's fine , that 's great . Okay . She 's on the other line , she 's gon na call me back . inference: Chandler left a message and is anxiously waiting for Danielle's call.

I have pride" and then reveals that he's not proud at all by saying "I'm fine". Additionally, he says "She's on the other line, she's going to call me back" multiple times, indicating that he's anxiously waiting for her call.
opposing_explanation: Chandler Bing's behavior and dialogue suggest that he is not anxiously waiting for Danielle's call, but rather attempting to convince Monica and himself of that fact.

original_item_data.dialogue:
#NOTE#: [ Scene : Central Perk . Monica , Chandler , and Ross are seated . Rachel is walking over with coffee and a piece of pie . ]

#NOTE#: [ Someone bumps into Rachel and she drops the pie in a guy 's hood that 's seated at the table . She improvises by using the plate as a saucer for the coffee . ]

Rachel Green: OK , here we go . Honey , I 'm sorry , they were all out of apple pie , someone just got the last piece .

Phoebe Buffay: Oh my God , oh my God , oh my God , oh my God . You are not gon na believe this . I have just been discovered .

Chandler Bing: Now wait a minute , I claimed you in the name of France four years ago .

Phoebe Buffay: Anyway , OK , now promise you wo n't like , freak out and say how great this is until I 'm done , OK .

#ALL#: OK .

Phoebe Buffay: OK . I just met this producer of this like , teeny record company , who said that I have a very fresh , offbeat sound and she wants to do a demo of Smelly Cat .

#ALL#: [ congradulating her and celebrating ]

Phoebe Buffay: I told you not to do that yet . And , she wants to do a video .

#ALL#: [ celebrating more ]

Phoebe Buffay: I 'm not done yet , OK . God . OK , if that goes well , they may even want to make an album .

Phoebe Buffay: I 'm done now .

#ALL#: [ celebrating ] [ the guy with the pie in his hood get up to leave ]

Rachel Green: Oh God . Ross , OK , if you care about me at all , you will get the pie out of the man 's hood .

Ross Geller: Get the what ?

Rachel Green: Pie in the hood , pie in the hood . Go .

Guy: What 're you doing ?

Ross Geller: I 'm sorry , my pie was , was in your hood . Now I just have to get the coffee out of that guy 's pants and I 'll be back in the hospital by 7.
original_item_data.inference: Ross's mention of returning to the hospital by 7 is an exaggeration of the consequences of the mishap.
original_item_data.human_annotated_explanation: Ross's mention of the hospital is clearly an exaggerated response to a minor issue, which adds humor to the situation.

inference: Ross's mention of returning to the hospital by 7 is an exaggeration of the consequences of the mishap.
supporting_explanation: Ross's mention of returning to the hospital by 7 is an understatement of the consequences of the mishap, as evidenced by his earlier statement "all I need to do is get the coffee out of his pants and I'll be back in the hospital by 7," which is an absurd and humorous exaggeration of the situation.
opposing_explanation: Ross's statement about returning to the hospital by 7 is not an exaggeration, but rather a matter-of-fact comment about his plan to take care of the pie and the coffee situation after he gets the pie out of the guy's hood.

Rachel Green: Oh ! I see . And I 've sort of been maintaining my amateur status so that I can waitress in the Olympics .

original_item_data.human_annotated_explanation: Chandler is frustrated that his tests point to a mundane job in data processing.

inference: Chandler is upset because he learned his ideal career is something he finds unfulfilling.
supporting_explanation: Chandler is upset because he learned his ideal career is something he finds unfulfilling.
